node.display_long_description:
2020 Winner of Best VR Meditation App by Men's Health and VR Fitness Insider, TRIPP helps you feel calm and focused.  Based on scientific research and used in several clinical studies, TRIPP helps to manage stress to help you stay healthy... inside and out.  

New in the latest update!
- Compose your own TRIPPs
- Access the Demo in the new Popular Menu

Try TRIPP for FREE today. For new daily meditations, customized experiences, and a trackable mindfulness journey, unlock the premium service. Get discounted Lifetime access* for a limited time only. 

*Limited time offer available for Lifetime access as in-app purchase. Subscription Plans available -  $3.99/month or $9.99/year thereafter. Cancel at any time. Terms apply. Go to tripp.com for more details.

nodes.title: Create Your Own TRIPP! The Composer Update now launched.
nodes.body_text: You have asked for the ability to TRIPP your way and our team has been listening! We have worked hard to create the ability for you to compose your own TRIPPs. This Is just the very beginning of this feature to our platform that will evolve over the next few months. We are so grateful for the support of all of our customers. Thank you and please send us feedback. We appreciate you!

nodes.title: Audio Quality Improvements!
nodes.body_text: We updated our audio mixing to allow you to hear the voice better in our experiences.  We are also improving the quality of the meditation guides for a better experience. Please email us at support@tripp.com if you have any more thoughts on how we can improve TRIPP for you. We hear you!!!

node.internet_connection_name: 下载内容需要连接网络

node.reviewDescription:
TRIPP is an interesting idea, and I'd love to use it... I  might even pay for it... except this one little thing:

TRIPP suffers from an issue I've found in a few VR apps.  You are expected to sit up and look forward.  Period.  At Attention, Soldier!

Sometimes, I enjoy my Quest and VR experience while simply relaxing and lounging in bed.  I do not wish to sit at attention or have to look forward.  I wish to look up.  I'm relaxing.  I'm in bed.  My head will be pointed at the ceiling... but in VR, it doesn't have to be this way.

I  have noticed that the developers of some apps have conquered the technology of being able to have the user orientated in any direction, and the app will adapt to this.  YouTube VR is a great example, and I think a couple of others do this too.  Sadly, TRIPP, which is meant to be a meditation app (ie relaxing), won't allow this.

My experience is literally... I'll start the app and realize, I can't access menus (or ANYTHING) unless I orient my face to look downward or straight ahead.  Then I just close the app and say, "yeah, no" and give up on it.

I'd appreciate the developers to research and implement the technology that would enable a user to access everything, from beginning to end, in which ever head orientation the user chooses... including relaxing, in bed, while looking up.

*** UPDATE ***

As the developer indicated, Tripp DOES have a “Recline Mode,” but this seems only available AFTER you sign up and purchase a membership, and cannot be seen while in demo mode.  Had I known this, I’d probably have signed up sooner, but was judging by what I saw, functionally, in demo mode
node.reviewTitle: Why I DO NOT use this app...

developerResponse.body:
Hi,
We ABSOLUTELY do support RECLINE mode. At the top of our main menu select RECLINE and Press A button to reposition the TRIPP experiences as needed.  Contact us at support@tripp.com so we can help you with this using this feature in TRIPP.
